meanings.definition: A metal fitting at the end of a scabbard.
meanings.sent1: The chape on the scabbard protects the blade.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the chape on the sword's scabbard.
meanings.sent3: The chape on the scabbard gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent4: The chape was like a guardian at the sword's sheath, keeping it safe.
meanings.sent5: The knight's chape was engraved with ancient symbols, adding to its mystique.

meanings.definition: To fit or secure with a chape.
meanings.sent1: He carefully chaped the scabbard to ensure a snug fit.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith chaped the sword's scabbard expertly.
meanings.sent3: She chaped the scabbard with precision, making sure it wouldn't slip off.
meanings.sent4: The craftsman chaped the scabbard as if it were a work of art.
meanings.sent5: Chaping the scabbard securely was crucial for the sword's protection.

meanings.definition: The lower part of a sword blade.
meanings.sent1: The chape of the sword blade was well-crafted and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: He examined the chape of the sword blade closely.
meanings.sent3: The chape of the sword blade was surprisingly heavy.
meanings.sent4: The chape of the sword blade gleamed in the dim light of the armory.
meanings.sent5: The warrior's skill was evident in the sharpness of the chape of the sword blade.
